Adds the callback to the given callback group.

Parameters:
group The name of the group to add the callback to.

Disconnects from the signal that triggers this callback.

QVariant DzCallBack::getArg ( int  i  )  const [slot]
Returns:
The i'th argument from the current execution of the callback.
int DzCallBack::getArgCount (  )  const [slot]
Returns:
The number of arguments for the current execution of the callback.
bool DzCallBack::getBlockedDuringSceneLoad (  )  const [slot]
Returns:
true if this call back is not processed during scene loads but at end of scene load.
QStringList DzCallBack::getGroups (  )  const [slot]
Returns:
A list of the groups that this callback belongs to.
bool DzCallBack::getProcessAsEvent (  )  const [slot]
Returns:
true if this call back is processed as an event
QString DzCallBack::getScript (  )  const [slot]
Returns:
The script that is executed when the signal is emitted.
const QObject * DzCallBack::getSender (  )  const [slot]
Returns:
The object that sent the signal, or NULL.
bool DzCallBack::isEvaluated (  )  [slot]
Returns:
true if the script text for this callback is the actual code that gets executed, false if the script text contains the filename of the script to execute.
void DzCallBack::removeFromGroup ( const QString &  group  )  [slot]

Removes the callback from the given callback group.

Parameters:
group The name of the group to remove the callback from.
void DzCallBack::setBlockedDuringSceneLoad ( bool  onOff  )  [slot]
Parameters:
onOff true for on, false for off. Sets this call back to not be execute while the scene is loading. If it is then the script will execute when scene load is finished. Scripts executed after the scene load is finished have no arguments and the sender is always the one first connected to, not the one sending the signal.
bool DzCallBack::setConnection ( const QObject *  sender,
const QString &  signal,
bool  garbageCollect 
) [slot]

Makes the connection that triggers this callback.

Parameters:
sender The object that the signal belongs to.
signal The signature of the signal to connect to.
garbageCollect if true remove this call back from the DzCallBackMgr if the sender is deleted.
bool DzCallBack::setConnection ( const QObject *  sender,
const QString &  signal 
) [slot]

Makes the connection that triggers this callback.

Parameters:
sender The object that the signal belongs to.
signal The signature of the signal to connect to.
int DzCallBack::setConnections ( const QObject *  sender,
const QStringList &  signalList,
bool  garbageCollect 
) [slot]

Makes the connection that triggers this callback.

Parameters:
sender The object that the signal belongs to.
signalList List of signal signatures to connect to.
garbageCollect if true remove this call back from the DzCallBackMgr if the sender is deleted.
Returns:
number of connections in list that connect or -1 if no sender
void DzCallBack::setProcessAsEvent ( bool  onOff  )  [slot]
Parameters:
onOff true for on, false for off. Sets this call back to trigger as when reached in the event stack. Scripts executed in this manner have no arguments and the sender is always the one first connected to, not the one sending the signal.
void DzCallBack::setScript ( const QString &  script,
bool  evaluate 
) [slot]

Sets the script that will be executed by this callback.

Parameters:
script The filename or actual text of the script to execute
evaluate If true, the given script is the actual code that should be evaluated, otherwise, it is assumed that the given text is the name of a script file to execute.
